The claim was analyzed in comparison to: indicating a pattern of misinformation in the industry.
The content of the 66: page story on BleacherBreaker.com was thoroughly examined, revealing that it did not mention a "former Disney World Princess" or any grand "truth" being revealed.
The use of a stock photograph from Alamy: com in the advertisement, which was identified as a picture taken at the premiere of "The Princess Diaries," a Walt Disney Pictures production, raised doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Other sources: such as BuzzFeed, Inside the Magic, and Vox, were consulted to check for any related interviews or information about a former Disney princess, but they did not seem to support or align with the claim made on BleacherBreaker.com.
